org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service

Class UserService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service.UserService

  • @Service
public class UserService
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for handling all request to the backend concerning an user. This includes registering, resetting passwords , etc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserService

        @Autowired
public UserService(OuService ouService,
                               org.springframework.boot.web.client.RestTemplateBuilder builder,
                               @Value(value="${backend.url}")
                               java.lang.String backendUrl)

    • Method Detail

      • registerUser

        public MethodResult registerUser(User user,
                                 java.util.UUID organizationId)
                          throws BackendException
        Registers the given user with Jack the Clipper.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to be registered with all his details
        organizationId - The id of the organization the user should belong to
        Returns:
        The registered user holding only the necessary information for the application. E .g. passwords are not transmitted by the backend
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the registration of the user failed. Currenlty there is no way to determine why it failed though. There is no distinction between an already taken username or email

      • deleteUser

        public MethodResult deleteUser(java.util.UUID staffChiefId,
                               java.util.UUID userId)
                        throws BackendException
        Deletes the account of the specified user. Thus the user will not be able to use Jack the Clipper anymore
        Parameters:
        staffChiefId - The staffChief removing the user from his organizationalUnit
        userId - The id of the user that should be removed
        Returns:
        A MethodResult indicating the success or failure of the call. Callers need to check MethodResult.state to see whether the request truly was successful.
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the user could not be registered

      • resetPassword

        public void resetPassword(java.lang.String eMail)
                   throws BackendException
        Triggers the reset of a user's password. This is invoked when a user has forgotten his password and thus cannot authenticate himself to Jack the Clipper. If a user wants to set a new password himself updatePassword(UUID, String) should be used.
        Parameters:
        eMail - The mail of the user who forgot his password
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the password for the specified mail could not be reset

      • updatePassword

        public void updatePassword(java.util.UUID userId,
                           java.lang.String newPassword)
                    throws BackendException
        Sets the password of a user. This implies that the password is intentionally being set by the user. If a user forgets his password, resetPassword(String) is the method that should be used.
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user changing his password
        newPassword - The new password in plain text. The backend will do the hashing
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the update of the password failed

      • updateMail

        public void updateMail(java.util.UUID userId,
                       java.lang.String newEMail)
                throws BackendException
        Updates the email of a user. The email must be unique in the entirety of the Jack the Clipper application as it is used to uniquely identify a user.
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user that wants to change his email
        newEMail - The new email address
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the update of the mail address failed

      • authenticate

        public User authenticate(java.lang.String username,
                         java.lang.String organization,
                         java.lang.String password)
                  throws org.springframework.web.client.HttpClientErrorException.BadRequest
        Tries to authenticate the given credentials by throwing them against the backend
        Parameters:
        username - The name of the user. This might be an emailadress which is unique for every user or a username which is just unique within one organization
        organization - The organization the user presumably belongs to
        password - The entered password of the user
        Returns:
        The authenticated user
        Throws:
        HttpClientErrorException.BadRequest - If the backend could not authenticate the user

      • getManageableUsers

        public java.util.List<MinimalUser> getManageableUsers(java.util.UUID userId)
                                               throws BackendException
        Returns which users a given user can manage. No full User objects are returned but only a Tuple. Tuple.first() will return MinimalUser.userId, while Tuple.second() will return MinimalUser.name.
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user requesting the information
        Returns:
        A list of MinimalUser representing a user's id , username and whether he is unlocked respectively.
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call to the backend failed due to HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST.

      • getUserInformation

        public ExtendedUser getUserInformation(java.util.UUID requesterId,
                                       java.util.UUID requestedId)
                                throws BackendException
        Retrieves additional information of a user. This is intended for users with UserRole.StaffChief roles. With this they can see to which OrganizationalUnits a User belongs to.
        Parameters:
        requesterId - The id of the user requesting the information
        requestedId - The id of the user the information is requested of
        Returns:
        An ExtendedUser holding all information one can manage about a user
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or returned nothing

      • addUser

        public MethodResult addUser(java.util.UUID staffChiefId,
                            UserUuidsTuple basicUserInfo)
                     throws BackendException
        Lets a user with UserRole.StaffChief add an user. The difference to registerUser(User, UUID) is that this method indicates that the user himself did not make an effort to gain access to the application. Also users created by this method are valid per default and do not need to wait until they are unlocked
        Parameters:
        staffChiefId - The id of the user adding the new user
        basicUserInfo - A Tuple holding the minimal information that is needed to register a user
        Returns:
        A MethodResult indicating the success or failure of the call. Callers need to check MethodResult.state to see whether the request truly was successful.
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or did return with a null body or an HttpStatus that is not 2xx.

      • modifyUser

        public MethodResult modifyUser(java.util.UUID staffChiefId,
                               UserUuidsTuple updatedInformation)
                        throws BackendException
        Modifies an already existing User. This can be used by a user with UserRole.StaffChief privileges to promote other users to UserRole.StaffChief or unlock them so that they can use the application.
        Parameters:
        staffChiefId - The id of the User with UserRole.StaffChief privileges wanting to modify a user, to e.g unlock them
        updatedInformation - The user that should be updated
        Returns:
        A MethodResult indicating the success or failure of the call. Callers need to check MethodResult.state to see whether the request truly was successful.
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or did return with a null body or an HttpStatus that is not 2xx.
